title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I had several interviews with different people. It was at least a 3-4 month process from start to finish, with long waits between phone screen, then Zoom interviews, then offer.
Interview Questions: Why I want to work at NAU and in higher ed in general.

title: IT Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straightforward and not heavily technical. Mainly situational and hypothetical questions were asked. These were questions such as workflow, issue priority, and assessment of deadlines. Additionally, since travel and on-site installations is typically required, questions regarding these tasks were asked.
Interview Questions: If a deadline is approaching, how would you assess this situation if the current workflow of the team is not successful or seeing any progression?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Received an email request for an interview about 3–4 weeks after applying. Still in progress, but there will be a writing test and second, final interview if I advance. I’m looking forward to hearing back from NAU soon!
Interview Questions: Describe a time you went above and beyond your work responsibilities.

title: Peer Math Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: I had a very casual and standard interview process. Just sat at a round table and was asked very standard interview questions. This was done pre-COVID so I am not sure how the experience is now, but I imagine it is the same.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with conflict.

title: Academic Success Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: It was only one interview that involved personal questions with some questions about your tutoring methods. It helped to know someone who was currently working there and could recommend you.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching approach?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: After applying online and completing a few short-response online interview questions, I was called for a phone interview, which took no more than 10 minutes.  They only asked a handful of questions that were very easy to answer.
Interview Questions: What will you do to promote inclusion and tolerance of people in marginalized groups as a Housing & Residence Life employee?

title: Warehouse Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straight forward and short. Very to the point and proactive. Those who were present were nice and personable and made the whole process easy as they could.
Interview Questions: Do you mind working around your school schedule in the mornings and in the afternoons?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I apply through the referral. I got call form for to set up interview. It was face to face interview. Most question Hr question. It was 30 minutes long interview. Next day I got call for verbal offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: I had an in person interview with five people interviewing me. Each person took turns asking questions about my experience and inquiring about the ways I would envision improving the role.
Interview Questions: What are ways you would communicate this new program across multiple departments and stakeholders?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: Background info and simple and easy. they ask for your resume and what interests you. equality over everything. and they were kind and respectful. they ask general questions to get to know you more.
Interview Questions: What interests you in this job and how do you think you will do?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: There were 12 people on a Zoom. The group was not prepared.  Adamant about being at the University full-time. Seemed very old school even at the beginning of the Pandemic when everyone was still online.
Interview Questions: What kind of supervisor are you?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: Overall interview experience was positive. There were a sequence of interviews with an interview committee. Questions were situational in nature, the interview was not overly technical. The offer/hiring process itself was quick and a great experience compared to other interview/hiring processes I have experienced in the past.
Interview Questions: Describe an experience working in a team environment where you handled different competing priorities.

title: Grants and Contracts Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then about 2 weeks later I got an email for the interview. I had a panel interview with 4 interviewers then I got a call the next day with an offer.
Interview Questions: Questions regarding past professional experience, Microsoft software skills, ect.

title: Admission Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (South Houston, TX) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy  It was more a conversation than an Staff was friendly but it seemed like an assembly line with 3 other people waiting to be interviewed. He provided good details about the job and explained the expectations. He was quick and to the point and allowed me time to represent myself and skills
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself?

title: Apprentice Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: The employer asked several questions and got to know my overall personality as well as coding skills.  It was a friendly environment with several members of the team I would be working with
Interview Questions: How do you keep up with current technology trends?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my professional goals and why I wanted to work as a research assistant. I was asked about my personal life, and then I was told about the different projects and responsibilities that I would be working on. I was also asked multiple scenario questions about what would I do if 'this' happened. Such as a deadline approaching and how I would prioritize certain tasks
Interview Questions: How would you deal with multiple tasks at an approaching deadline. How would you prioritize them?

title: Research Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a 50 minute seminar to the department, followed by a question and answer period. It was fairly casual. The department put me up in a hotel and paid for meals.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a research faculty at NAU?

title: Student Worker Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: There was only one interview with two interviewees. It was pretty simple; they asked basic situational and behavioral questions. Overall, a simple interview, which makes sense because it was a part-time student worker position.
Interview Questions: Situational questions

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: 20 questions, 50% technical, 50% behavioral. Interviewers were kind. They were fast to respond. No white boarding was necessary. Took about a week to finish the whole process. They are very quick with this process at Northern Arizona University.
Interview Questions: Tell me your experience with oracle database.

title: Front Desk Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was particularly easy because of the interviewer's open-minded disposition. She asked all of the questions that were just right for getting to understand the people she hires and how they will advance the reputation of the University over time.
Interview Questions: What leadership qualities do you believe you possess and what leads you to believe so?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with a panel of 4 people that work in the department.  They each asked a couple questions.  Very standard interview for an administrative job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your computer skills.

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy and laid back. You had to be a student for the university though. In addition, the whole process took a week. I would also like  to mention that you have are given different scenarios that you have to answer.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your patience?

title: Student Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 5 people, 2 were students, 3 were full-time employees. Asked common HR questions along with a few technical questions about web development. The interview lasted 1.5 hours. Asked about an unanimous object's purpose. They just wanted to see what I would say. Interesting interview.
Interview Questions: What is this object used for?

title: Finance Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through NAU Handshake, scheduled an in-person interview about a week later. The interview itself was very easy, just answered situational and behavioral questions and reviewed which classes I could tutor.
Interview Questions: How would you help a student who came into a tutoring schedule who was discouraged after failing an exam?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brief, 30-40 minute phone interview. There was a panel of a handful of faculty members of varying professional backgrounds. They asked a series of questions pre-determined by the university, and not really any others, besides a couple followups to what I said.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Went for the interview when I applied for their MBA program,  got an email the next day offering me admission, scholarship, and a job as a Graduate Assistant.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial Phone interview of 30 mins, then the 2nd phone interview lasted 45 mins. The on campus interview lasted 1 1/2 days with dinner the first night, campus tour, meeting with the Dean and the VP of Student Affairs, then panel interview with the Office of Student Life, lunch with student leaders and large group interview with students.
Interview Questions: How much does Diversity and Inclusion is incorporated in your strategic plan.

title: Physical Therapy Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview at the Downtown Phoenix location for the Northern Arizona doctoral physical therapy program. Overall, the questions were very fair but the number of students interviewing at one time was intimidating.
Interview Questions: They asked what set us apart from other applicants.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was simple with friendly interaction from department employees. I arrived early and was able to begin the interview when I arrived. I was interviewed by two people who switched off asking questions.
Interview Questions: If someone asked a question about a policy you didn't know, and everyone was in a meeting, how would you answer that person?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: You will be given a topic in mathematics for which you are to suppose to prepare and teach that topic to a class. For instance, how will you teach the concept of sets to a 1000 level class.
Interview Questions: Prior teaching experience

title: Instructional Technologist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions:
Called for interview and they wanted the interview on a specific day. Obliged their request and traveled for the interview.  No offers to pay for anything.  Scheduling done by a friendly HR scheduler. All the communication went through the scheduler.  She was super nice, but had to run any changes past their committee.  Paid way too much on travel expenses, such as plane ticket, rental car, hotel, etc.   The process was very formalized.  Met at the door, taken in for the interview, signed papers, asked questions, escorted out.  

Received a very rude canned rejection call two days later.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have as a manager?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: No interview was necessary for this position.  I did end up visiting the campus for a day before I decided to enroll in the master's program, but it was by choice and not a formal interview.  After I accepted the admission offer, I was offered a contract as a graduate teaching assistant (GTA) which is renewable on a yearly basis.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Residence Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions:
easy , long  day 1-1 q&a's with upper management , RHD's and RA's  Lack of  communication 
was not offered breakfast when headed to the airport ... Free lunch and dinner   90 min interview with a boring panel  21 questions  mostly scenario questions easy common sense questions. Asked about student development theory . Your in a RHD apartment if your coming from far away. No TV so bring your computer. Students up til 2am so bring ear plugs if your sensitive to  that kind of noise.
Interview Questions: Scenario question , common sense things

title: Student Admissions Specialist, Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: Expressed interest in management position to professional staff; they scheduled interview shortly after. The selection process involves professional staff observing your on-the-job competencies well before you even apply for the position. The entry-level student position is Student Admissions Specialist, and you must hold that position for at least a year before attempting to apply for the senior position.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
What is your management style?
Tell me about a time you overcame a difficult situation.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two days of interviewing included an informal introduction to the department, interview with the search committee via conference call, student interview session, 1-hour interview one-on-one with the dean, research talk (informal, yet well attended), two dinner interviews with faculty, and a lunch interview with faculty. Overall, the interview was not as stressful as others, however I could tell that the graduate level students and the faculty took the interview seriously. I received an offer within 1-week of the in person interview process.
Interview Questions: How will you make living in Flagstaff work for you and your family?

title: Senior Systems Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone interview with 3 people, fairly easy, tons of programming questions, but again easy ones, second interview in person with about 12 people sitting around a table. tons of technical questions, about half programming and about half systems administration
Interview Questions: what protocol runs on port 443?

title: Student Bus Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process wasn't that bad. It was mainly one of the supervisors informing me about the job and the essential duties that will be performed on a daily basis.
Interview Questions: When did you first start driving?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview with director sitting in the administrator's office in northern campus. He was very nice and they needed a replacement for the previous web developer. He asked me several questions and the interview went very well.
Interview Questions: Are you a fast learner and do you know flash?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application to the University for the PhD Program.  Was accepted but only after they offered me a paying position while other universities offered me free tuition.  If I had known about the near double cost of living expenses in Flagstaff I would have turned them down for a more urban environment where the option to work outside of the University was viable.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back, student position so they were just looking for competence.   Just easy questions about availability and understanding how to answer phone calls and write emails.
Interview Questions: Q: What hours will you be available?

title: AFP Member At Campus Disability Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University
Interview Descriptions: I found the position open on Jobs for Jacks (site for students to find jobs).  I emailed the main coordinator saying I was interested in applying and asked for the application, then I filled out the detailed application with a few long questions (asking about how you deal with conflicts, etc.). A faculty member of NAU that I was in a program with sent in a recommendation for me, though I don't think it's necessary. I was asked in for an interview and it was a basic process. Questions about why I think I'm right for the job, my past experience, classic interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you most interested you about this position?

title: CIS 120 Teachers Assistant/Lab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
You must expect to end the class with an A.
Sending your resume to the professor in charge, if they email you back you'll have an interview.
Meeting with one of the professors one-on-one in their office.
Interview Questions: If you notice a student having trouble keeping up with the course load, what would you do to help?

title: Assistant Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I was hired as an intern to assist with the editing of the catalog for The Institute for Human Development.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Transcript Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met with a supervisor and had a one on one interview- there was supposed to be a group of people, but they couldn't make it for some reason.  It felt rushed and unprepared for on the interviewer side.  It felt like they just use stock questions to ask you, pretty simple interview, but it would depend on the position applied for.  Then I received an official offer via email for the position.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses, strengths?

title: Facilities Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sumbitted a paper application to the FAS HR office. They photocopied and distributed to the shop managers. Each manager gets to review the app and see if they want to interview you. I visited a certain shop and introduced myself, and was interviewed on the spot and given employment paperwork to fill out. High turnover with students, so apply often.
Interview Questions: Are you available to work more than a couple hours each week?

title: Mobile Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Outline what you want to achieve and what you need to complete your project.
Interview Questions: There were no questions.

title: Grounds Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview. They are just looking for people who have a strong work ethic and play well with others. The school hires students for cheap labor and to give students a chance to earn some money on the side and gain some job skills.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a coworker who is not motivated to work?

title: Group Fitness Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: After taking the semester long Group X Instructor course you are required to perform a "demo" where you host a class for a small(4-6) group of people. Management attends to rate your performance
Interview Questions: How would you modify this program for said individual with (blank) injury?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application and CV to a job advert on an email list serve, and was contacted to set up a phone interview with two of the supervisors of the position about a week later.  It was unexpectedly brief and consisted only of one phone interview, and no visit.  It was a conversation that lasted approximately 30 or 40 minutes, and I was called back and offered the position a week later.
Interview Questions: I was asked how I thought I would handle learned new skills that were completely foreign to me.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Online application, group and individual interview. Both interviews are in front of a panel of RAs and RHDs. In the group interview, most of the panel is silent observers. In the individual interview, each person takes turns asking you questions. It can be awkward because they are hand writing exactly what you say.
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you?

title: Systems Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume online at NAU HR website, after several months (resumes screening and panel discussion, I found out later), did a phone interview with five people - hiring manager and four others (various backgrounds, financial, IT, academic and department).  Called in for in person interview which lasted around five hours (they provided lunch), given tour of facility, interview, met several potential co-workers, then lunch and meeting with student workers.  Came away very excited about the possibility of working there, especially for the hiring manager.  Received call ten days later with offer and start date.  Accepted immediately.
Interview Questions: No questions were out of the ordinary, the most difficult for me has always been what is the weakness that you need to work on.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Keep checking the HR website.  There are some great positions available!  The interview process can vary between departments, but for my newest position, it was a quick hiring process.  One interview, job was announced shortly after the interview, and I was able to start immediately.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you deserve this position over any other candidate?

title: Print Shop Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: pretty easy.  Just a few short informal questions.  Showed me around the office.  Introduced me to staff, asked what wage I wanted.  offered me the job on the spot.  yay
Interview Questions: Do you know how to run a copier

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Terrible terrible terrible. Board of regents and governor do not value higher education therefore do not value professors. You stay because you love it not because the pay or benefits are commensurate to your level of education
Interview Questions: tell us about your professional experience

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Faculty hiring is a national search process. the position is advertised on various magazines like spectrum, asee prism, etc as well as online. first, the applications are vetted by a committee of at least 4 faculty. Then, telephone interviews are held. Once the top few are chosen, reference checks are done. Then a campus interview.
Interview Questions: Professional behaviour is important.

title: Radio Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: It's confused and riddled with communication errors. No one has proper paperwork, and can often ask multiple times to see the same forms.
Interview Questions: Where do you want to go within this department

title: Associate Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northern Arizona University (Flagstaff, AZ) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone interview with a panel of interviewers. It went very well and the questions were what I expected: my experience, skills, software knowledge, and a discussion of both their expectations and mine. A week later, I was offered the job, pending a background check. The background check took ten days. I accepted the offer by phone and fax. I didn't meet anyone until I showed up for work. The interview by phone process was a good experience.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working with difficult people?
